## Impact of using hashtags

```{r #rstats, echo = FALSE}
rstats = read.csv("C:/Users/dfs20/OneDrive - Newcastle University/Stage 2/Jumping Rivers/rtweet_analysis/Data/hashtags/rstats_hashtag_tweets.csv")

rstats = rstats %>%
  filter(is_retweet == FALSE & is_quote == FALSE)
rstats = rstats %>%
  select(favorite_count, retweet_count, hashtags)
  
num_of_hashtags = as.array(rep(0,nrow(rstats)))
for(i in 1:nrow(rstats)){
  num_of_hashtags[i] = str_count(rstats[i,3], "\\w+")
  rstats = rstats %>%
    mutate(interactions = favorite_count + retweet_count,
           hashtag_num = num_of_hashtags)
}

ggplot(rstats_tweets) +
  geom_smooth(aes(interactions,hashtag_num)) +
  xlim(0,25) +
  xlab("Number of interactions") + 
  ylab("Number of hashtags used")
  
```

```{r jr timeline, include = FALSE}
#no argument in get_timeline() for excluding retweets
jr_timeline = read.csv("C:/Users/dfs20/OneDrive - Newcastle University/Stage 2/Jumping Rivers/rtweet_analysis/Data/jr timeline/jr_timeline.csv")

jr_timeline = jr_timeline %>%
  filter(is_retweet == FALSE & is_quote == FALSE)
jr_timeline = jr_timeline %>%
  select(created_at, favorite_count, retweet_count, mentions_screen_name, hashtags, media_type)

hour = as.array(rep(0,nrow(jr_timeline)))
for(i in 1:nrow(jr_timeline)){
  hour[i] = substring(jr_timeline[i,1], 12, 13)
  jr_timeline = jr_timeline %>%
    mutate(hour_posted = hour, interactions = retweet_count + favorite_count)
}


```
